5. Conclusion
A custom designed chatbot has been demonstrated, building on the capabilities of ChatGPT to help improve
health literacy in the management of T2DM. The chatbot fulfilled the requirements to use medically informed
information, constrain responses and respect privacy, in a flexible development environment.
When evaluated on a specialist led simulated patient conversation, 75% of the answers (15) were evaluated to be

were due to the RAG chatbot straying away from the contents of the documents sourced by it. Forcing the chatbot to
answer exclusively from the source documents could be quite limiting in the breadth of health literacy patients need.
Future work may trial this approach with patients and examine other methods to ensure the chatbot balances the
